issues.title: Add note on honoring GSHUT on IXPs
issues.author: ichdasich
issues.body:
At the moment the draft does not discuss honoring GSHUT on IXPs.

As this is crucial for being able to drain traffic, adding a note might be useful.

issues.title: Discuss use of lpref on IXP RS
issues.author: ichdasich
issues.body: Adding a note on the use of lpref on IXPs that prevent draining traffic (related to #1) might make sense.

issues.title: Add note on need for individual judgement
issues.author: ichdasich
issues.body: As noted by GD, it is still a "my network, my rules" thing. The introduction should explicitly mention that the BP should be considered by individual operators, and there may be very good reasons to deviate, e.g., limited vendor support.

issues.title: Discussing MED based oscilation (RFC7964)
issues.author: ichdasich
issues.body: With RS MED can lead to route oscillation overloading speakers. This is discussed in RFC7964, and a note on monitoring for that/precautions might be useful.

issues.title: Expand Community filtering
issues.author: ichdasich
issues.body:
Martin Pels notes:
- I think extended (RFC4360) communities should also be added here.
- Another point to add in this section is scrubbing communities from a received route if the number of attached communities is excessively high (e.g. > 100).

issues.title: Adjust attribute scrubbing
issues.author: ichdasich
issues.body:
Martin Pels notes:

- Add MAY for scrubbing of attributes

"operators MAY opt to scrub all BGP attributes known to cause service 
disruptions"

I would suggest replacing the word "all" with "specific", or to add a 
line explicitly clarifying not to scrub unknown transitive attributes.

issues.title: Add to 7.2.2 or similar that using communities to signal validation status is a bad idea
issues.author: ichdasich
issues.body: appending a community to signal the validation status of a prefix is generally considered a bad idea

comments.author: job
comments.body:
Yes.

I have plans to specifically address this issue in a new internet-draft
“Associating validation states with BGP communities considered harmful”.

I think it’s worth spending a few pages on this on *why* exactly it’s a bad
idea. Perhaps useful to refer to that to-be-written doc instead of pulling
in walls of text?

comments.author: ichdasich
comments.body: Makes sense; Will keep an eye out for the draft and use a template reference until it is out.
